channel.itunes:subtitle: Truth vs Hype
channel.itunes:author: NDTV
channel.itunes:summary: Truth vs Hype travels to the Ground Zero of the biggest story. Every week, re-defining reportage on Indian television.
channel.description: Truth vs Hype travels to the Ground Zero of the biggest story. Every week, re-defining reportage on Indian television.

item.title: Truth vs Hype: Gaza, No Place to Be Young
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: If you are a six-year-old in Gaza, you have already lived through three wars. We look at what growing up in a conflict zone means for the very young.
item.itunes:summary: If you are a six-year-old in Gaza, you have already lived through three wars. Using this devastating statistic as a lens, we look at what growing up in a conflict zone means for the very young. There is the risk of injury or death, and of mental scars. But even those who make it are faced with a deeper crisis, where this tiny, claustrophobic strip, closed off on all sides, has become a dead end for their dreams.
item.itunes:keywords: Gaza Conflict,Hamas,Israel Ceasefire,Gaza War,Truth Vs Hype,conflict zone

item.title: Truth vs Hype: Gaza - Notes From an Unequal War
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: As the tenous ceasefire breaks down and war returns to Gaza Strip, we dissect the anatomy of the ugly nature of the conflict, one of the most complex in the world.
item.itunes:summary: As the tenous ceasefire breaks down and war returns to Gaza Strip, we dissect the anatomy of the ugly nature of the conflict, one of the most complex in the world. It's even more complex to report because of the propaganda battles that both sides are fighting, each feeding off each other: the real war and the virtual war.
item.itunes:keywords: Gaza strike,Israel,Gaza attacks on Israel,Gaza Conflict,Hamas,Hamas Rockets,Israel Ceasefire,Palestine,Hamas rocket fires,civilian area

item.title: Truth vs Hype: Inside Gaza
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: Truth vs Hype: Inside Gaza
item.itunes:summary: Gaza is not unfamiliar to war but never at this scale. Already, new terrible records are being set. This week, Truth vs Hype travels to Gaza to report on the many facets of this brutal conflict : how Gaza's young are the most vulnerable victims of Gaza violence, on how Israel's claims that its a 'humanitarian' army do not match the ground reality, and Hamas' double edged role in this war as protectors and also perpetrators of violence.
item.itunes:keywords: Gaza strike,Israeli military,Hamas,Islamic University,Gaza's Largest Mosque,Al Shefayee mosque,Truth Vs Hype

item.title: Truth vs Hype - Delhi's Power Games
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: Power prices went up in Delhi this month, prompting the usual protests, which led us to plunge into the debate: are electricity rates too high in the city? Are the distribution companies making huge profits ? O
item.itunes:summary: Power prices went up in Delhi this month, prompting the usual protests, which led us to plunge into the debate: are electricity rates too high in the city? Are the distribution companies making huge profits ? Or as these companies claim, the truth is the exact reverse- prices are too low, and they have mounted crores of loss? This week we try and decode the exasperatingly complex world of Delhi's power pricing, which is representative of the flare ups over power tariffs in other Indian cities.
item.itunes:keywords: BSES,Power crisis,Power prices,Truth vs Hype,electricity rates,power tariffs

item.title: Truth vs Hype - Man-Made Drought?
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: The late monsoons have meant that a very large percentage of crops have not been planted, impacting livelihoods and food prices. Water is still scarce for irrigation and drinking.
item.itunes:summary: The late monsoons have meant that a very large percentage of crops have not been planted, impacting livelihoods and food prices. Water is still scarce for irrigation and drinking. As always, our politicians blame the rain gods, but as found out that the reasons for the water crisis are man made - whether it's manufacturing water shortage in cities to justify thousands of crores of dams or how the crisis in West and Central India acutely hit by drought may have been exacerbated by the need to supply uninterrupted electricity during election time.

item.title: Truth vs Hype: Cartels, Politics and False Alarms - The Anatomy of Onion Pricing
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we travelled to Nasik, the heart of India's onion belt, to understand the forces that determine the trade of this politically volatile vegetable.
item.itunes:summary: This week we travelled to Nasik, the heart of India's onion belt, to understand the forces that determine the trade of this politically volatile vegetable. We attempt to get inside the tightly controlled ecosystems of traders and political patrons who control the ebb and flow of onions across the country, whose rising prices have raising anxiety levels in the corridors of power.
item.itunes:keywords: Nasik,Onion Prices,vegetable prices,onion Mandis,Onion Pricing,Truth Vs Hype

item.title: Truth vs Hype: The Myth of Power Crisis
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: Summer has come, and with it the inevitable power cuts, and the familiar solutions to end India's power crisis: build more power plants, increase coal mining (never mind those pesky environmental laws), and hike power rates.
item.itunes:summary: Summer has come, and with it the inevitable power cuts, and the familiar solutions to end India's power crisis: build more power plants, increase coal mining (never mind those pesky environmental laws), and hike power rates. This week on Truth vs Hype we discover how each of these assumptions don't stand up to scrutiny. Indeed, pursuing them might come at a high environmental and social cost.
item.itunes:keywords: Truth vs Hype,Power Crisis,power plants,Coal Mining,Power Shortage

item.title: Truth vs Hype: Myth of the Foreign Hand
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: The Intelligence Bureau report, which alleges that a clutch of foreign funded NGOs have deliberately stalled India's growth continues to spark a raging debate. We take a hard look at the IB's allegations: do they have the facts to back their claims?
item.itunes:summary: The Intelligence Bureau report, which alleges that a clutch of foreign funded NGOs have deliberately stalled India's growth continues to spark a raging debate. We take a hard look at the IB's allegations: do they have the facts to back their claims? And has the IB grossly oversimplified the complex equation between foreign funds, NGOs and policymakers?
item.itunes:keywords: Climate Works Foundation,Greenpeace India,NGO,Gujarat Government Projects,Intelligence Bureau,Narendra Modi,Truth Vs Hype,foreign funded NGOs

item.title: Truth vs Hype: The Black Money Primer
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: We look at challenges before SIT, set up by government to unearth black money.
item.itunes:summary: One of the first decisions of the Narendra Modi government has been the setting up of a Special Investigation Team to give speed up unearthing of black money stashed abroad and in India. This week, we summarise some of the challenges - political, procedural and legal - that the SIT may face at it attempts to track down the billions of dollars that are supposed to form India's black economy.
item.itunes:keywords: Lok Sabha Elections 2014,Truth Vs Hype,Prime Minister Narendra Modi,Black Money,Narendra Modi,swiss bank,Modi goverment

item.title: Truth vs Hype - Governance, Modi-fied
item.itunes:author: Sreenivasan Jain
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, we report on the buzz in Delhi's corridors of power, which are already getting a taste of the working style of the Modi sarkar, as well as the new Prime Minister's possible priorities, of which economic revival seems to be key.
item.itunes:summary: Even before he formally takes office with his team, Narendra Modi has hit the decks running, asking for presentations from bureaucrats, shaping policy proposals, even mulling a downsized government. This week, we report on the buzz in Delhi's corridors of power, which are already getting a taste of the working style of the Modi sarkar, as well as the new Prime Minister's possible priorities, of which economic revival seems to be key.
item.itunes:keywords: Prime Minister of India,Narendra Modi,BJP,Narendra Modi's team,Truth vs Hype,Lok Sabha elections 2014
